meanings.definition: The quality or power of attracting or being attracted.
meanings.sent1: The attractances of the colorful flowers drew in many bees.
meanings.sent2: The magnet's strong attractances pulled the metal objects towards it.
meanings.sent3: The attractances of the delicious food made everyone want to try it.
meanings.sent4: Her warm smile had an attractances that brightened up the room.
meanings.sent5: The puppy's playful energy had an irresistible attractances.

meanings.definition: Something that attracts or has the power to attract.
meanings.sent1: The shiny object on the ground caught the bird's attractances.
meanings.sent2: The new store in town became an attractances for shoppers.
meanings.sent3: The attractances of the mysterious book made it hard to put down.
meanings.sent4: His charisma was an attractances that drew people towards him.
meanings.sent5: The bright lights of the city were a powerful attractances for tourists.
